isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - TOWING - TOWING INSTRUCTIONS: VEHICLES WITH DRIVER CONTROLLED MAIN DIFFERENTIAL LOCKS

svcproc.title: TOWING INSTRUCTIONS: VEHICLES WITH DRIVER CONTROLLED MAIN DIFFERENTIAL LOCKS

caution.para: When towing a vehicle with the wheels of one or both drive axles on the ground, it is possible to damage the axles or cause additional damage if the wrong procedure is used before towing begins.

step1.para: If the drive axles are equipped with a driver controlled main differential lock, shift the driver controlled main differential lock to the unlocked (disengaged) position. The differential lock light in the cab of the vehicle will go out.

note.para: If the air supply to the differential lock is lost, the shift collar will unlock (disengage).

step1.para: Identify each axle shaft so that they can be installed in the same location after the repair is completed.
Remove both axle shafts that will remain on the ground while the vehicle is being towed. Follow the procedures in the DISASSEMBLE section of this manual.

note.para: If the axle is equipped with a driver controlled main differential lock, the left-hand front axle shaft and right-hand rear axle shaft of tandem axles have two sets of splines. One set of splines is engaged with the side gear and one set is engaged with the shift collar. It may be necessary to rotate the shaft when pulling it through the shift collar ( Figure 6).

step1.para: Install a cover over the openings of both hubs to retain the lubricant and keep dirt from entering the hub.
Remove the covers from the wheel hubs.

If the drive axles are equipped with a main differential lock, shift the differential to the unlocked (disengaged) position. Install the axle shafts with two sets of splines and new gaskets in the correct location as follows ( Figure 6):

step2.para: Push the axle shaft and gasket into the hub and housing until the shaft stops against the differential lock shift collar.
Push down and in on the axle shaft flange and rotate the shaft until the splines of the shaft and the shift collar are engaged.
Push the axle shaft further into the housing until the shaft stops against the differential side gear.
Push down on the axle shaft flange and rotate the shaft until the splines of the shaft and the side gear are engaged.
Push the axle shaft completely into the housing until the axle shaft flange and gasket are flush against the wheel hub.

step1.para: Install the other axle shafts at the locations from where they were removed. Follow the procedures described in the ASSEMBLE section of this manual.

Check the lubricant level in the axles and hubs where the axle shafts were removed. Add axle lubricant if necessary. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for recommended lubes.
